elements.name: willSearchDownloadExplanation
elements.title:
This step will help you fill out the "Application for Search of Wills Notice". You need to do this step even if {deceasedName} did not make a Will so that The Court is satisfied that there is no Will.

For more information click here for the Wills Registry page. (This link opens in a new tab)

If you have already applied for a Search of Wills Notice, ensure that it was done with all of the names you identified in the Form P10.

If there are different spellings or versions of [deceased name]'s name on the Form P10 that aren't in your original Search of Wills Notice, you will need to do another "Application for Search of Wills Notice" with the extra names.

Click here to download a blank "Application for Search of Wills Notice". (This link opens in a new tab)

To open the PDF, you may need Adobe Reader (free to download) or other similar software.

Click here to download Adobe Reader for free. (This link opens in a new tab)

elements.name: willSearchTipsInstructions
elements.title: Below are some tips on how to fill out the Application for Search of Wills Notice.

elements.name: willSearchTip1
elements.title:
Applicant's Information

Fill in information about yourself.

"RELATIONSHIP TO THE SUBJECT OF THE WILL SEARCH" means your relationship to {deceasedName}. For example, write "spouse", "child", or the relationship as the case may be.

elements.name: willSearchTipA
elements.title:
SECTION A - APPLICATION FOR WILLS SEARCH

Make sure you have a photocopy of the `Certificate of Death` included when you send your "Application for Search of Wills Notice." Your signature is required in Section A.

If the person died in BC and you have not obtained the death certificate, click here for more information on how to obtain one. (This link opens in a new tab)

If the person died outside of BC, you must obtain an official death certificate from the authorities where the death occurred.

elements.name: willSearchTipB
elements.title:
SECTION B - SOLICITORS OR NOTARIES ONLY

Leave this section blank.

elements.name: willSearchTipC
elements.title:
SECTION C - SEARCH REQUEST DETAILS

"SURNAME" means last name or family name.
"Given Names" means first name and middle names.

When you fill out the names, start with the surname in capital letters, and then add the given names.
    For example, with Alex Bowie Clark, the surname is Clark and the given names are Alex Bowie. For this form, write the name in as CLARK, Alex Bowie.
Make sure to include all the different spellings and versions of {deceased name}'s name you wrote down in the Form P10.

elements.name: willSearchTipPayment
elements.title:
PAYMENT METHODS

If you are making the application by mail, complete this section with payment information and sign it. If you are making the application in-person at a Service BC Centre, leave this section blank.

elements.name: willSearchTipPrint
elements.title:
Save and print the document

You have the option to save this document to your computer and/or you can press the Print button at the top or bottom of the PDF.

Send the Application for Search of Wills Notice to Vital Statistics Agency using the contact information on Page 2. This form does not go to The Court.

Vital Statistics Agency will send you a document called "Search of Wills Notice" when they are done with their search. You will need to include 2 copies of the "Search of Wills Notice" in your application to The Court.
